intro: Phragmipedium × pfitzerianum, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Phragmipedium kovachii and Phragmipedium sanderianum. It is a terrestrial orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. The plant features upright, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil. This hybrid is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
